data.title: 2024 Australia Airshows and Scheduled Flying Days
data.meta_description: 2024 AUSTRALIAN AIRSHOWS AND SCHEDULED FLYING DAYS   Airshows Downunder Shellharbour - Friday 1, Saturday 2 and Sunday 3 March 2024 - airshow display days 2 & 3 March 2024, Shel
data.text:
Post by colford on

2024 AUSTRALIAN AIRSHOWS AND SCHEDULED FLYING DAYS

Airshows Downunder Shellharbour - Friday 1, Saturday 2 and Sunday 3 March 2024 - airshow display days 2 & 3 March 2024, Shellharbour Airport, NSW. Gates open 9.00AM, displays commence at 10.00AM. Display ends 4.00PM.

Tyabb Airshow - Sunday March 10, 2024. Stuart Road, Tyabb Victoria. Gate open 8.30AM, displays commence 10.00AM. Display ends 4.00PM

2024 Lake Boga Splash In & Rev-Up - Sunday 10 March 2024, Lake Boga Aviation Museum, Willakool Drive, Lake Boga, Victoria

Warbirds Over Scone 2024 - Saturday 23 and Sunday 24 March 2024, Scone Airport, NSW. Gates open 9.00AM, displays commence 10.30AM. Display ends 4.00PM

Aldinga Airshow - Sunday 7 April 2024, Aldinga AIrfield, Colville Road, Aldinga SA. Gates open 8.30AM, displays commence 10.30AM. Display ends 4.00PM

Canberra Airport Open Day - Sunday 7 April 2024, Canberra Airport, Canberra, ACT. Gates open 9.00AM, gates close 3.00PM. Static aircraft display with limited aircraft display activity. (UPDATE - ADDED 09/02/2024).

Nhill Airshow - Saturday 13 April 2024, Nhill Airport, Nhill, Victoria.

ANZAC Weekend Airshow - Saturday 25 and Sunday 26 April 2024, West Sale Airport, Gippsland, Victoria. Gates open 9.00AM, displays commence 10.25AM. Display ends 3.30PM.

Central Coast Airshow 2024 - Saturday 25 and Sunday 26 May 2024, Central Coast Airport, Warnervale, NSW. Gates open 9.00AM, displays commence 10.30AM. Display ends 3.30PM.

Pacific Airshow Gold Coast - Friday 16, Saturday 17 and Sunday 18 August 2024, Surfers Paradise Beach, QLD. Times TBA. (UPDATE - ADDED 09/02/2024)

Mildura Airshow - Sunday 8 September 2024, Mildura Airport, Alan Matthews Drive, Mildura, Victoria. Gates open 9.00AM, flying commences 10.00AM to 4.00PM. (UPDATED - ADDED 14/12/2023, INFO UPDATE 13/07/2024.).

Temora Aviation Museum

Aircraft Showcases

Saturday 6 April 2024

Saturday 7 September 2024 - includes the Canberra Bomber Symposium 2024 at conclusion of days flying activity approx 2.30PM. Symposium until approx 4.00-4.30PM. (UPDATED - 13/07/2024)

Gates Open 10.00AM.

Warbirds Down Under 2024 - Saturday 19 and Sunday 20 October 2024, Temora Aviation Museum, Airport Rd, Temora NSW.

Historical Aircraft Restoration Society (HARS) - Shell Harbour Airport

Tarmac Weekends - Tarmac Days are held outside the HARS hangars on the second Friday, Saturday and Sunday of every month - 9.30AM to 3.30PM.

Any details come to hand of additional Airshows or Flying Days scheduled for 2024, will add the details to the list when they are known.

Post by Calum on

Will be interesting to see what the Airshows Downunder people bring to Shellharbour. So far I've seen nothing to fill me with confidence.. The only change of note so far is having to pre book parking. In my experience there was nothing wrong with the parking arrangement previously.

Post by colford on

For those who susbscribe to the Temora Aviation Museum newsletters and had advice of the pre-sale of tickets for WDU 2024 opening at 10AM today, already on presale as of 9.15AM. So if you want tickets, book NOW, selling fast! Ticketmaster member pre-sale is tomorrow morning at 9.15AM AEST and general public they go on sale Monday.

Calum, re Airshows DownUnder at Shellharbour, I understand from talking to some people that there were some issues with general public parking in previous years where majority were trying to access closest carpark(s) and they ended up with it overflowing, traffic banking up and then trying to redirect people. Pre booking parking allows them to ensure people go to carparks where there is capacity to have them park and not get turned away or redirected.

Post by 11SQNLDR on

Flights and tickets x 3 secured for Warbirds Downunder for myself and my two lads

My first trip to Temora and I'm really looking forward to it. Staying in Cootamundra for a couple of nights so will enjoy a couple of NSW country pubs as a bonus

We will visit the AWM in Canberra on the Sunday and flight back to Perth that evening.

Post by colford on

11SQNLDR, a handy Ando Recognition Chart.

Ando Recognition Chart by Colin Ford, on Flickr

Usually found roaming along the flightline near crowd central, microphone in hand, providing a comprehensive commentary on what is flying and its history, plus getting pilots to relate what it is like flying the aircraft they have been flying. Part of the "fabric" of a TAM Aircraft Showcase or major event.

Post by colford on

Australian Airshow scene for 2024 just got a bit more interesting with Paul Bennet Airshows announcing the arrival of Hawker Sea Fury and ex-Reno air racer 'Sawbones' in Australia from the USA. Will be interesting to see at which Australian airshow it makes its debut. Hopefully it will be joining the lineup for Warbirds Downunder 2024 at Temora in October. Going back a few years since I last saw a Hawker Sea Fury performing at an Australian airshow.

Just checked, what I think was either first or forerunner of Warbirds Down Under, November 2011.

Sea Fury Temora Nov 2011 by Colin Ford, on Flickr

Sea Fury Temora Nov 2011 2 by Colin Ford, on Flickr

Scheme on this new one is a lot easier and interesting for photography.
